official-title.#text:
To establish a commission to study how Federal laws and
		  policies affect United States citizens living in foreign
		  countries.

shall constitute a quorum, but a
			 lesser number of members may hold hearings.

text.#text:
A
			 majority of the members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select a Chairperson for the

from among its
			 members.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 conduct a study on how Federal laws and policies affect United States citizens
			 living in foreign countries, including civilians and members of the Armed
			 Forces.

text.#text: The
The matters studied shall include the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 5314 of title 31, United States Code

text.#text:
Federal financial reporting requirements
			 for a United States citizen living in a foreign country, including the
			 requirements under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (commonly known as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: chapter 4 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

quote.#tail:
) and requirements affecting
			 financial institutions imposed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (USA Patriot Act) (
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Uniting and Strengthening America by
			 Providing Appropriate Tools Required to Intercept and Obstruct Terrorism Act of
			 2001

text.#text:
Federal policies and requirements that
			 affect the ability of a United States citizen living in a foreign country to
			 access foreign and domestic financial institutions, including requirements
			 under

Federal
			 requirements for a spouse, child, or another family member of a United States
			 citizen living in a foreign country who is not a United States citizen to
			 become a United States citizen.

The ability of a
			 United States citizen living in a foreign country to vote in Federal, State,
			 and local elections in the United States, and the process for such a citizen to
			 vote in such elections.

The processes by
			 which a United States citizen living in a foreign country interacts with
			 Federal programs such as Social Security and Medicare.

The process for a
			 United States citizen living in a foreign country to get a Federal education
			 loan for such citizen or for such citizen’s child who is a United States
			 citizen.

Which Federal agencies have jurisdiction
			 over each Federal program that serves United States citizens who live in
			 foreign countries and possible methods to improve the collaboration of and
			 coordination between such Federal agencies.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Americans Living Abroad Act/s:4/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consult organizations that represent
			 United States citizens living in foreign countries.
